snippet: The financially troubled Postal Service said that, barring Congressional intervention, it would be unable to make $12.6 billion in payments for future retiree health benefits.
abstract: Postal Service, faced with continuing financial losses because of a drop in mail volume, expects to default for the first time on its annual payment for future retiree health benefits; missing the payment, which amounts to $5.5 billion, will not affect current retiree benefits.
lead_paragraph: The financially troubled Postal Service said that, barring Congressional intervention, it would be unable to make $12.6 billion in payments for future retiree health benefits.

headline.seo: Postal Service Set to Default on Billions in Health Payments
headline.main: Postal Service Set to Default on Billions in Health Fund Payments
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Set to Default on Billions in Health Fund Payments
